intro: Picrasma longistaminea, commonly known as the long-stamen picrasma, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Picrasmataceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
